136722067.review:
6 bucks for taking friends together in a fighter jet and learn from other players more directly? What is there to hesitate about?

Pros:
- Great for playing together with friends.
- Lets you fly together with another player so you can learn from each other more directly.
- Only 1 of the 2 people in the jet needs to own this DLC. So if you get this DLC, your friend doesn't have to own it and vice versa.
- Comes with a series of single player tasks.

Cons:
- Performance of the jet. This is actually an intended feature, but yeah, the thrust to weight ratio is really low. If I recall  correctly, the max TWR with no weapon and full internal fuel is ~0.94.
- In single player task, the flight leader is, well, a bit annoying. Pulls hard without noticing you, and keeps roasting you if you fly > 0.3 mile away from him. With the very low TWR, you basically need to fly near perfectly to keep him from constantly scolding you.

135907053.review:
Disclaimer: this review is only a downvote if you're looking for an objectively good combat aircraft. This isn't made to be that. It's a trainer. If you want to fly a trainer, or if you enjoy more realistic and less rocket-like planes go for it, this thing is awesome for that and that's why i got it.

i have an unpopular opinion: multiplayer doesn't add much to the experience of flying this aircraft. Sure, talking to the other pilot is cool and the CRM can be fun, but if anything, the communication needed to make effective use of the 2nd crewmember would make you less effective in combat, since you have to not only fly at your best as a pilot and keep 100% situational awareness as a RIO, but you also have to communicate with your crewmate. This isn't the type of aircraft that would benefit from having 2 crewmembers in combat.

Playing as pilot, the aircraft feels slower and less maneuverable than the F/A-26 and the F-45, which is arguably more realistic, but when you're competing against those planes in dogfights, you're always at a disadvantage.

Playing as a gunner / RIO, due to the small size of the aircraft, it can't carry as much ordinance as other planes, which forces you to RTB more often and makes it difficult to do solo attacks into enemy territory.

Objectively speaking, if you use this plane in a battle against any other plane in the game, you will likely lose. As a training aircraft, it's generally harder to fly than other aircraft due to its lack of power, which might be good if you subscribe to the "training should be harder than the real thing" philosophy, and if you have friends with VR headsets who want to get into flight sims, this is a good start for them.

135524312.review:
The T-55 tyro flies out for VTOL VR.

Sporting a modest engine, the plane is capable of supersonic speed, but it's not going to get there quick, and abusing the controls will take you right back to the subsonic regime. This ultimately forces the pilot to really think not just about what he needs to do (launch missile, bomb, etc), but also how he does it. Will you pull back hard on the stick and dump your speed to bring the nose around? will you baby the velocity indicator around to the direction you want, knowing your enemy might get outta the way or swing around behind you? 

The second seat also changes the focus of the craft - Yes, the sticker says "Trainer Jet" but I think of it more as "Advanced CAS platform". Having a second person isn't too useful when fighting other jets, but having someone fiddling with the targeting pod (or nav), searching, locking, and helping you fire at targets is really helpful when you're trying to dodge SAMs. The lowered thrust almost helps with this, since a slower jet means you have more guns-on-target time per run.

The T-55 has a few other things that "helps" or at least makes things more difficult to increase the challenge you face. The view from the second seat, whilst expected, isn't particularly good, forcing you to rely on instruments. The fueling port is behind the cockpit, which means you have to instead look at the lights on the bottom of the refueling aircraft. The plane has no rearview mirror, which means you gotta twist your head or make sure nobody gets back there. The engine at idle does not produce enough power for everything in both cockpits, and the battery will drain unless you ramp it up. The hook seems to be very finnicky, you need to follow the glideslope exactly, and stay under 200kts if you want a chance of catching it. 

All around, it's an instant-buy for me, with zero regrets. Boundless Dynamics (BahamutoD), is one of a few developers who's quality is so high that I don't need to wait for a reviews or other info to come out before buying. The cheapness of this DLC (Compared to the price of the game or the other DLC), means that I have no issue recommending this to anyone who enjoys or might enjoy VTOL VR. f

135461002.review: I played a mission that comes with this jet with a friend.  I was in his back seat.  All of a sudden 2 radar contacts appeared, we hid in the hills and looked up and we went "Holy shit there's 4!"  It was just like the final fight in the first top gun.  The sky exploded with bandits.  My friend in the front trying to pull a guy into his hud, meanwhile im in the back trying to track 3 separate bandits all coming around behind us.  "Bandit 8 O'clock coming arou- MISSILE MISSILE FLARE FLARE FLARE!"  Trying to keep track of all of them as my friend twisted and turned trying to dodge all the attacks is an experience in vr that can only happen with this dlc.  I cannot recommend this dlc enough, its incredibly fun, the single developer works hard and only makes quality products.  Please give him your money.

135439292.review: Incredible DLC, and honestly astounded at the low price-point.  I would pay $20-30 for this plane and the mission content.  Love the feel this single-engine machine.  Ability for your friends to drop-in copilot to help you manage targeting and navigation (and/or swap the flight stick!) just works incredibly well.  Will be using this to introduce friends to flying.I have not heard enough praise around how FUN it is to co-pilot.  Being able to use TGP and other systems while your buddy flies is strategically useful.  I'm pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoy the feeling of immersion; you can really take in the action and scenery at a whole new level (because you don't have to worry about crashing!).10/10, fun for solo or duo flying, lots of awesome mission content included (and awesome mods out there already).  A lot of love goes into a DLC like this to work this well.  Dev gave us what we asked for, and it's way better than I expected.

135380190.review: TL;DR: i recommend itHonestly not a bad plane, i just can't figure out whether it's supposed to be more of an F16 type or more of an Northrop  F5 type. Either way it's got a nice weapon variety for people just starting out in the game, doesn't have cruise missiles unfortunately and is limited in numbers in air to ground weaponry. The fact that only 1 person needs to have it is very nice though, it's a good way to get your friends into the game by being able to teach them directly. I already had a chance to try it out with someone who had just bought the game and teach them a bit, it's a really nice addition. While it is a trainer jet, you can also use it sort of like an air to ground F14 where one person manages the weapon/TGP systems while the other one only needs to focus on flying (as far as i'm aware that only works if the instructor, aka guy in the back, is the one managing the weapons). I'd say it's worth the price, even if you don't plan on teaching anyone and plan on flying solo, it's a nice plane to have over the F26

135375249.review: Is 5 bucks a fair price so that this dev can keep making this game? yes. Is the trainer jet easy to use as a teaching tool? yes. Is this DLC worth it? 100% yes

135374002.review: This aircraft has quickly become one of my favorite vehicles to fly in the game. It's a joy to fly and it truly feels like you're really in control of a flying machine. The T-55 DLC is a fantastic addition to the game. I highly recommend it to anyone who loves flying and wants to experience the thrill of piloting in VR.

135371504.review: A lil F-16 that can fit two sexually confused pre-pubecent air enthusiasts, what's not to love? On the real this is a great change-up for people like me who have flown the shit out of the F/A-26 and want a new experience. The ergonomics are very similar to the 26 but the cockpit is much more cozy and small. It can also carry all the weapons the F/A-26 can, it just has less hardpoints, due to its smaller size. It is a little sluggish with external fuel tanks, but if the pilot goes for full dogfighting loadout with only guns heaters and maybe some AMRAAMs, and you'll fight just fine. The single engine is great but will obviously not produce as much thrust as the F/A-26. The T-55 doesn't even have a 1.0 thrust to weight ratio with a full gas tank and nothing else. However, don't let that make you think this thing can't move, try it out, Ms. Tyro will surprise you just like any good multi million dollar thrill ride.The feeling of LARPing as a WSO as your pilot flies for both your lives is an amazing adrenaline rush and obviously, the training features of the aircraft are also amazing, allowing the back-seater to mirror his MFDs to the pilot's, being able to selectively take control of the aircraft, and obviously provide moral support ;). The way the aircraft works aerodynamically also lends itself to new pilots, as even I, a fairly experienced pilot can get carried away with the stick on the F/A-26 due to its powerful engines. The scaling back of the size and engine power lends itself to education on BFM and energy usage. It's a great tool for introducing friends to the game and even just havin some fun with a bud. Thank you Baha, you're a legend for your development and on the behalf of the community I thank you with every fiber of my being...(and my money).

135361256.review: Outstanding implementation of the instructor/training philosophy - there's various switches and functions which address the needs of a training platform and were perfectly implemented into the cockpit. Aircraft performance is set perfectly to firstly [i]slow down[/i] the pace of a battle for the student and, secondly, to highlight the importance of energy management.The rear seat control lockout switch position also enables the aircraft to be operated as a two-crew aircraft where one can be gunner/radar operator(etc) whilst the other one flies, for those that want to use it as a multi-crew jet in combat.Overall it's a superb piece of DLC that fills a gap in many different facets of VTOL VR gameplay (both for PVE & PVP) and worth a heck of a lot more than the asking price.

135351088.review: review is as of 1.6.1.    The new jet is great, i'm super happy that they're adding multicrew jets to the game!    However, dogfighting is not an option in this jet, as it does not make any thrust.  It may look like an F-16, and the multicrew aspect is fantastic, but feeling like you're in a model airplane powered by 5 matches in front of a desk fan... in the middle of a warzone... not so great.     I would recommend picking up the Heli DLC, as you need to have that to get in the thing, and finding someone on a public server to hop in their T-55 (because you can do that without owning it) and deciding if you actually want to buy it after that.    Remember, it looks like an F-16, but it ain't one.  It's powered by the equivalent of a handheld blowtorch. The thing can't even break mach if you have a single weapon on it, and having weapons with a Thrust to Weight ratio over 0.8 is a dream.   Multicrew good, Jet... not so much.

135336532.review: Oh my goodness, where do I even begin with this VTOL VR DLC featuring the jet plane? It is an absolute game-changer, a breathtaking addition that will leave you on the edge of your seat!The moment you step into the cockpit of this sleek, powerful jet, you will feel like a true Top Gun pilot, soaring high above the clouds and performing daring aerial maneuvers that will make your heart race with excitement. The graphics are so stunningly realistic that you will feel like you are actually flying through the skies, with every twist and turn of the plane perfectly replicated in the game.And let's talk about the controls for a moment. They are absolutely phenomenal, giving you complete and total control over every aspect of the plane's flight. From adjusting the throttle to performing intricate barrel rolls, you will feel like a true master of the skies as you pilot this incredible machine.But what really sets this DLC apart is the emotional connection you will form with the plane itself. You will come to know every inch of its body intimately, feeling every vibration and gust of wind as you soar through the air. And when you inevitably encounter enemy fighters, you will feel a fierce protectiveness for your beloved jet, fighting tooth and nail to ensure its safety.Overall, I cannot recommend this VTOL VR DLC featuring the jet plane enough. It is a thrilling, heart-pumping addition to an already amazing game, and it will leave you feeling like a true aviation hero. So buckle up, strap in, and get ready to take to the skies like never before!

135334750.review:
Editing my review, because I got a few hours in with this plane now.

Short review: This plane is outright just a smaller F/A-26 that's harder to fly, with 2 seats. the underpowered engine holds it back, and frankly, even a 5 percent bump to it's power would... really help this dinky little thing out.

Long review: I still recommend this little plane. It is a great trainer, but is also a respectable multirole with a wide array of weaponry (Same as the F/A-26, just with a smaller amount it can carry per flight)

Long story long, here's why I recommend it:

This plane is plenty effective as a single-seater, but opens plenty of opportunities as a dual-seater. I will list negatives as well as positives, and I will compare it to the F/A-26 almost all the time.

Compared to the F/A-26, this plane feels... Well, VERY Underpowered. It has a much weaker engine.

Due to the plane having a much smaller engine and being overall lighter and smaller, adding weapons will make this plane sluggish and fly like a prized pig very, very quickly. So plan out your attacks, and jettison things if necessary.

That being said, If you pack this thing light, put on an external fuel tank that you can jettison and keep the internal fuel at 40 percent capacity, you can just about match the F/A-26.

Due to the efficient engine, that 40 percent fuel will last you a fair bit of time, so a 40 percent full internal fuel tank... Can take you places.

This little plane can pull... a fairly high AOA. It bleeds speed extremely quickly while pulling that AOA, but that dinky little engine makes it a chore to regain that speed.

I need to stress... having a full fuel tank and external weapons... impacts it's performance VERY harshly. If you expect trouble, enemy fighters specifically, make sure you can dump weight quickly via the jettison.

Because of it's weak engine, The much more powerful F/A-26 can VERY easily outperform the T-55 if the pilot is unprepared and over-loaded.

What's this little plane's purpose? Well, it's lack of engine power and dual seater capability matches it's description: It is a trainer meant to teach you the importance of energy management, flight dynamics, flight controls, system management, teamwork and combat maneuvering and BFM.

In combat, this plane is a fairly good gunfighter. Even if you equip about 2 missiles to the plane, it will stay a good threat.

It can carry a decent amount of BVR weaponry (Aim-120's as an example) as well as a decent bit of Anti ground weaponry. it can do some ground-pounding for sure, and lug a very heavy load, if you need to.
